item.title: Chemistry medal awarded to Griffith academic
item.description: Twenty years of analytical science has paid off for a Griffith University professor as he is awarded the 2011 Lloyd Smythe Medal for Analytical Chemistry.

item.title: Habitat connectivity improves fish numbers
item.description: Marine reserves located in areas where mangroves and reefs are close together help to successfully increase fish numbers.

item.title: Quantum computing expert is Young Tall Poppy
item.description: The revolutionary solutions offered by quantum computing are under the spotlight as Griffith's Dr Erik Streed is named in the 2011 Queensland Young Tall Poppy Science Awards

item.title: Griffith paves way for new antimalarials
item.description: The development of new antimalarials which overcome the long-fought challenges of drug resistance is the focus of promising research at Griffith University.

item.title: Higher education accolades for Griffith science
item.description: The Griffith Science Education Alliance and Science on the GO! outreach program are under the spotlight as a Griffith environment researcher is named a winner at the 2011 Business/Higher Education Round Table (B-HERT) Awards.

item.title: Symposium highlights adventure racing concern
item.description: The burgeoning popularity of adventure racing events in national parks is causing increasing environmental concern, says research from Griffith and Murdoch Universities.

item.title: Griffith studies environmental threats to the Great Barrier Reef
item.description:
Uncovering the science behind the diminishing levels of coral on Australia's Great Barrier Reef is the goal of a unique study led by
Griffith University.

item.title: New approach to early breast cancer management gives hope
item.description: A quantum leap forward in breast cancer research provides new hope for sufferers.

item.title: Griffith University and Dreamworld bid to improve koala breeding
item.description:
Improving the breeding success of koalas in captivity is the aim of a collaborative
research study between Griffith University and Dreamworld.

item.title: Pierrot Lunaire with Merlyn Quaife
item.description: One of Australiaâ€™s most distinguished sopranos will light up the stage at the Queensland Conservatorium next week during a special one night only performance for Brisbane audiences.
